oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Bernhardt Wall, Etcher
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This small print of a man on a horse (with the words, "Bernhardt Wall, Etcher," underneath it) serves as the signature page or insignia of Bernhardt Wall, the artist who created this book of Andrew Jackson prints.

Bernhardt Wall completed books of etchings on a number of important historical figures, including Lincoln, Jackson, Mark Twain, Jefferson, and Lafayette, in addition to diverse subjects, including World War I, Greenwich Village, and "Man's Best Friend," dogs. His art was exhibited at a number of locations, and his works are now located in various repositories throughout the world. Wall received a degree of Doctor of Humane Letters from Lincoln Memorial University in 1939. During his lifetime, his art was exhibited at a number of locations and his works are now located in various repositories throughout the world.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Wall, Bernhardt, 1872-1956
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Jackson, Andrew, 1767-1845; Wall, Bernhardt, 1872-1956
Horses; Cowboys
